description: I see people saying that there is no playback works perfectly for me. My one gripe is that it forces telemetry with lbry while your logged in.

First, I love the idea of a blockchain alternative to Youtube without the censorship and the dangers of content removal.

Now, I managed to install the application but the sign in process was a chore and should be reworked to simplify it and maybe offer 2FA or QR codes as an alternative to email verification.

Regarding the UI;

It really needs some reorganizing, for instance it took me a few mins to figure where I can find my subscriptions. And last but not least, I see the wallet address is different to the one on Android so pointing out why it's different to newbies to not make them panic when their LBC balance shows 0 would be nice to have. 

That's all I've noticed at first sight, thanks for creating this platform
summary: Great platform, UI needs some work

description: The app is working, but cannot find ffmpeg for video transcoding
Playback does not work. What is the point?
summary: It would be great if it worked

description: The app self-upgrades. It crashes at the end of this, and then cannot run afterwards.
The app displays an update available, proceeds to download update and crashes.
Looks like this is out of date, also, the app has a self update mechanism that should be disabled on flatpak format.

It's missing some minor features and things that I believe it should have (ratings, upload analytics, playlists, more video controls such as an option to change resolution, etc), but it is otherwise an amazing platform and I can't wait to see it grow and where it ends up heading!

The app has been running fine for me, only thing that annoyed me was it automatically starts downloading the videos but this is easily disabled in the settings. There are more and more content creators on here all the time and soon I will be able to leave youtube behind for the most part. 9/10
summary: App works well potentially a good alternative to youtube

description: It will try to minimize to tray when closed, even when it's set not to. Then it will launch another instance when opened from the app launcher, Gnome has no system tray. Opening and closing it will quickly fill up your ram, soon you'll have to do a "killall lbry-app". It has no issues running under XWayland.
summary: The App is Terrible on Gnome, LBRY itself is a great platform

description: It's a viable youtube alternative even though there are not a ton of content creators there. There are quite a few though so you really want to check this out. The only thing that I don't love about it is that the application has access to the home directory which is not ideal - nonetheless this is open source and should be safe.
Neat video platform. I love it.

La idea de un servicio de streaming descentralizado es muy innovadora. Además, el sistema de pagos directos a los creadores lo hace una alternativa muy apetecible a las grandes plataformas como YouTube.
